reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart Light Switch HS200, Single Pole, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required , White, HS200
reviews.text: I've bought 12 TP-Link smart light switches over the past 3-4 years. Two weeks ago, one just stopped working. I figured, okay, stuff happens. But then—boom—another one dies the following week. The day after that? A third one goes out. That’s three failures in under two weeks. Out of curiosity, I checked TP-Link’s website. Surprise, surprise: the warranty is only 1–2 years. Guess what? All three failed right after the warranty expired. These things aren’t defective — they’re engineered to fail once you’re no longer covered. That’s not a coincidence. That’s a planned-obsolescence scam. These smart switches are not “smart”—they’re a stupid waste of money. Regular light switches last 10–20 years, while these overpriced plastic toys can’t even last two. DO NOT BUY these switches. I don’t care how fancy the app is or what brand it is — TP-Link or otherwise. If it needs replacing every couple of years, it’s trash. Stick with old-school switches. They’re cheap, reliable, and they don’t leave you in the dark — literally.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2025
reviews.title: TP-Link Smart Switches Are Garbage – Built to Break, Total Scam

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart Light Switch HS200, Single Pole, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required , White, HS200
reviews.text: This switch died in 3 years 6 months. It was making a clicking sound and the light was going on and off. A reset, a reboot, and killing the power to it did not help. Doing a search of this problem found quite a few results of others having this issue and the switch was shot. This was my first Kasa switch, I usually use another brand of smart switch that has been around for over 20 years and have much older ones than this Kasa switch that still work fine. I guess you get what you pay for.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2025
reviews.title: Lasted 3 years, 6 months

reviews.text: I’m done with Kasa. It took me the better part of a day to get two smart plugs and one smart switch to connect after multiple rounds of troubleshooting on each. When I added a second switch I had more connections problems except that none of the troubleshooting ideas worked. And one of the plugs lost its connection and I can’t get it back. I have other brands of these devices that have worked the first time, every time. Time to move on from Kasa.

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart Light Switch HS200, Single Pole, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required , White, HS200
reviews.text: The Kasa Smart Light Switch HS200 is a fantastic upgrade—and you don’t need to be an electrician to install it. Just take note of your old wiring setup before swapping in the Kasa switch. The printed instructions in the box aren't great, but the product description and YouTube videos make installation very straightforward. Pro tip: check behind your wall plate with a flashlight before buying to ensure you have the required wires. The whole process took me under 30 minutes—just remember to cut the power at your breaker box. Set up was smooth once I downloaded the Kasa app and created an account ahead of time. The LED ring can be hard to see in a bright room during Wi-Fi pairing, and expect a short wait for a firmware update after connecting. Alexa integration was seamless—it appeared instantly in the app once linked. You might need a file if your box extends past the wall to get the plate level. If your box is recessed, small plastic washers are available to bring the switch level to the wall—don’t use metal ones, as they’re not insulated. I had no problem using the existing wall plate with the Kasa switch. After 3 months of use, it’s been rock-solid. Highly recommended!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2025
reviews.title: Smart Upgrade Made Easy – Great Switch, Just Read Ahead!

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart Light Switch HS200, Single Pole, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required , White, HS200
reviews.text: I would give this product zero stars if I could. I purchased ELEVEN of these switches and 9 worked consistently while 2 became worthless when they refused to continue working and would not allow a reset. Then I decided to switch my internet provider and that was the end of all of them. I’ve followed TP Link’s instruction to change WiFi settings as well as numerous other suggestions on the internet from many others that experienced the same frustrating problem but to no avail. These switches refuse to connect to a new provider and are now nothing but complete garbage and a giant waste of money. I am now forced to purchase eleven brand new switches and start over but I’ll be looking for a more reliable alternative and won’t bother giving TP link another cent of my money for their worthless switches of which they provide zero customer support for. BUYER BEWARE. THESE SWITCHES ARE GARBAGE.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2025
reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!!! WASTE OF MONEY!’

reviews.text: Purchased this smart switch to control a fan on a patio. Easy to install but the directions for Wifi set up are not real clear - but I was able to get things working. The information provided by Amazon is not completely accurate. The info provided indicates the switch electrical connections are screw terminals but they are actually wire pigtails. I originally selected this switch because of the stated "screw terminals" and was unhappy to see the pigtails. So I'm providing a "3" rating for the time being and will bump that up or down in a couple of months depending on the status of the switch at that time.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2025
reviews.title: Kasa H-200 Smart Switch Review

reviews.productTitle: Kasa Smart Light Switch HS200, Single Pole, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Light Switch Works with Alexa and Google Home, UL Certified, No Hub Required , White, HS200
reviews.text: One of the most frustrating things about these and the other TP Link/Kasa models, is that the information about using 2.4Ghz wifi is discreet. I spent a few hours troubleshooting before I found it in a thread on a forum. I believe some of these are returned due to folks not being able to find this information, and they get stuck trying to set the units up. The only other trouble I've had, is one (out of about 10) units will sometimes be delayed, or it will turn on, then right back off instantly. Only happens on occasion, but makes me wonder if it's safe. Otherwise no big issues. To set up, I had to force my phone to 2.4Ghz wifi, otherwise it just spins and fails....even though it says it connected to the unit, it won't finish the set up. Hope this helps others.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2025
reviews.title: MUST USE 2.4Ghz Wi-Fi !!
